summary: The bill, titled the Defending American Jobs and Investment Act, aims to counteract foreign countries' use of extraterritorial and discriminatory taxes. It mandates the Secretary of the Treasury to report on such taxes, engage in discussions with affected countries, and implement remedies like increased tax rates on citizens and corporations of those countries, as well as potential procurement restrictions and considerations in tax treaty negotiations. The bill seeks to protect American businesses and investments from unfair tax practices.
